name: Vienna Marriott Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel was just what we had expected. It is an attractive property, and its location is convenient to excellent restaurants and most attractions.
reviews.title: Just as expected

reviews.text: The room was spacious with 2 queen sized beds and plenty of storage space. The bathroom was very clean.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: My wife and I spent 3 days at this property towards the end of June. As is usual for urban Marriott's, the location was ideal. Centrally located to just about anywhere you would want to walk to, a few blocks away from the opera house, Nachmarket (the outdoor food market not to be missed), the main shopping promenade and close to the superb subway system.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a Beautiful City

reviews.text: Please note that the subway station is described on the Marriott site as "Stuben Ring", while the subway map presents it as "Stubentor". This stop is on the U3 line and makes for a very quick, cheap and efficient way of getting to the hotel from the Sud Bahnhoff main railway station. Once at the street level, find your way to the street named “Park Ring” and walk 2 blocks to the hotel.
reviews.title: Corporate Culture

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was nicely appointed, rather large for Europe and contained a comfortable king bed. I was slightly disappointed that I wasn't upgraded based upon my Platinum status in the Rewards program, however. We did take full advantage of complimentary access to the excellent Executive Lounge for breakfast and late afternoon snacks. Conspicuously missing from the lounge at this European property was Internet access, which we did have in several other cities along this trip.
reviews.title: Luxury on the Ring

reviews.text: We stayed at the Vienna for three nights in December 2006.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

likes.disliked: — The fact that hte room was not ready until 3 and a half hours after the check-in time.

reviews.text: Overall the hotel was very good and we had a great time.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

likes.liked: — Size and cleanliness of the room

reviews.text: The only negative was our room was not ready on arrival, we got there about 10 minutes after you were allowed to check in, but our room was not ready. The receptionist put a positive spin on it, stored our cases and told us where to find some christmas markets. When we got back to the hotel (three hours later) our room was still not ready and there were many other people waiting in reception, but our room was ready soon afterwards.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: The room was great. We stayed in a twin room, with two large beds, ample space to use as a quad room if you wish to bunk up. The room was large and the beds were very comfortable, we didnt want to get up in the morning! The room also had a good bathroom, lots of wardrobe and drawer space and a well stocked mini bar. There was also a hairdryer. On the last day we also found a UK plug socket to the left of the television unit - I dont know if this is in all rooms.
reviews.title: A waltz into Vienna

reviews.text: The maid service was great. On many occasions we did not leave the room until after 12 (after some late nights!) and had the "do not disturb" sign on. When we came back to our room in the evening the room had always been visited and teh maid even organised our possession in the bathroom!
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.text: Americana in the heart of Vienna...New property on a park on first ring...walked to everything city center...wonderful help at front desk and on the phone...received an excellent rate via the website (147 euros/night)
reviews.title: Good Choice!

reviews.text: I arrived at the hotel close to midnight after taking the train into the city from the airport. The airport city train is 9euros each way and puts you into the middle of Vienna and a short walk or 5 euro cab ride from most of the major city hotels.
reviews.title: Great hotel for everyone.
best experience
reviews.text: The hotel lobby is immaculate with a nice seating area by check in that serves as a nice waiting area. As I was checking in late there was no one at the desk but a ring of the bell and service was instant.

My room was quite small but typical for a European hotel. The room itself was comfortable and clean and overlooked the inner part of the hotel. Not much sunlight gets to the room but that's not a problem since I was away from the hotel for the vast majority of the day. The bed was huge and immensely comfortable, with so many pillows.
reviews.title: Everything you'd expect from 5 stars

likes.disliked: — modern facade not in keeping with city's architecture

reviews.text: The bathroom was tiny but very clean. The products were plentiful and excellent and the towels were fluffy and also plentiful. My minor gripe was the quality of the TP and that sometimes the shower (which was good) ran hot and cold at times.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

likes.liked: — Happy and attentive staff & comfertable rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one week, October 5-12, 2006. This is an excellent business hotel. The lobby concierges are excellent and extremely helpful. She was able to obtain two tickets to the Vienna Philharmonic conducted by Ricardo Muti, in the Musikverein which, according to local friends, is virtually impossible.
reviews.title: Nice hotel/great location

likes.disliked: — Room cleanliness and service/amenities in executive lounge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a few problems on check-in as the bathroom tile was seriously overgrown with mildew, something I have never experienced in Europe. The housekeeping staff was "clueless" about how to clean it and I was insistent on a room change which the front desk manager kindly obliged the next morning.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel - would stay here again!

reviews.text: We stayed on the executive floor which has a nice lounge. You have your choice of a limited continental breakfast in the lounge or a full breakfast buffet in the main dining room for no extra charge. Plus, the in-room minibar is complimentary. The executive floor lounge had much to be desired in terms of service, food and amenities (meaning they do not provide any computers for use by guests on the floor unlike every other Marriott executive lounge). I have stayed at the Prague and Berlin Marriotts which do a great job and have excellent food and drinks not to mention exceptional service. The evening lounge attendant, at the Vienna Marriott, didn't even acknowledge guests and was very unhelpful when asked for something.
reviews.title: Excellent location and handy for sights

likes.liked: — The very central location with all transport links on the doorstep
likes.disliked: — Nothing to dislike really. Does most things well.

reviews.text: Overall, we had a good stay. Our room overlooked the StadtPark. The hotel is quiet, front desk staff and concierge are great, housekeeping is so-so, and executive lounge leaves a lot to be desired. However, I definitely would stay here again, for sure.
reviews.title: Excellent stay at the Vienna Marriott
Marriott is great!
reviews.text: Great hotel! My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in September 2006. The location is perfect! It is right across the street from Stadt Park on the Ringstrasse. There are 2 U-Bahn stations that are very close by and it walking distance to many locations. We walked to the Innere Stadt every day, as the hotel is just a couple of blocks away. It is in a very safe area with a lot of restaurants and cafes nearby. It is also close to great shopping. The hotel itself is very nice. Great lobby and restaurant. We had breakfast there each morning and it was good. The service was a little slow, but the wait staff was very nice and accommodating. The concierge was wonderful – so helpful and knowledgeable! Our room and bathroom was a very good size and extremely clean. We used the gym and pool once and it too was small, but nice. Vienna, in general, is a lovely city. There are so many beautiful parks, great museums and so much to see and do. This hotel was a great place to stay. I would absolutely stay here again!

description: Feel at home. The Vienna Marriott Hotel awaits you with warm Viennese geniality in an inviting and international atmosphere. Being situated in the heart of Vienna, all of the city´s major attractions lie within walking distance and can easily be reached by foot. St. Stephen´s Cathedral, the State Opera, theaters and numerous of the famous museums reveal themselves while you are strolling the elegant Ring Road.
